alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 9:02AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by snowmelt from recent warm temperatures and strong mountain winds. * WHERE...A portion of east central California, including the following county, Mono. * WHEN...Until noon PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over mountain roads near creeks and streams. Hazards for backcountry recreation activities through early this week in Mono County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 849 AM PDT, gauge reports of several small streams in Mono county indicate flows remain high due to snowmelt. Cooler temperatures and weaker winds Tuesday and beyond should bring a slight decrease in stream flows by Wednesday afternoon, although streams are expected to remain elevated and fast. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Areas near eastern Sierra creeks and streams across Mono County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
